required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Povidone-iodine Against Sodium Hypochlorite as Skin Antiseptics
clinical_study.official_title: Comparative Study of 10% Povidone-iodine Against 10% Sodium Hypochlorite as Skin Antiseptics in Human Volunteers.

collaborator.agency: Concejo de Ciencia y Tecnología del Estado de Guanajuato

brief_summary.textblock: The investigators have few options for skin antisepsis. Alternatives for povidone-iodine, which is the most commonly used agent, are costly or ineffective. To have more options, this study is needed. The investigators want to know if there are difference between the use of 10% sodium hypochlorite or 10% povidone-iodine for skin antisepsis.

detailed_description.textblock: Sodium hypochlorite at 10% has been widely used as antiseptic in patients on dialysis as well as for irrigation of wounds and burns. Since it has been used successfully in caring for the exit site of hemodialysis catheters, it is reasonable to propose its use for the insertion and care of central intravascular catheters, as well as for skin preparation before surgery. Alternatives for povidone-iodine, which is the agent most commonly used, are costly or ineffective. To have more options, this study is needed to know if 10% sodium hypochlorite is similar to the most common option for skin antisepsis.

primary_outcome.measure: Bacterial Count of Skin Cultures for the 10% Povidone-iodine Period
primary_outcome.description: Bacterial colony count of skin cultures to determine antiseptic properties

primary_outcome.measure: Bacterial Colony Forming Units for the 10% Sodium Hypochlorite Period
primary_outcome.description: After incubation, the outcome assessor counted the colonies to determine the colony-forming units per square centimeter (CFU/cm2) of skin.

primary_outcome.measure: Bacterial Colony Forming Units for the Control Period
primary_outcome.description: After incubation, the outcome assessor counted the colonies to determine the colony-forming units per square centimeter (CFU/cm2) of skin.

secondary_outcome.measure: Presence of Skin Reactions for the 10% Povidone-iodine Period
secondary_outcome.description: Presence of allergy or any skin reaction at 24 hours after the antiseptic application

secondary_outcome.measure: Presence af Allergy or Skin Reaction for the 10% Sodium Hypochlorite Period
secondary_outcome.description: Presence of allergy or skin reaction at 24 hours after the application of the antiseptic

arm_group.description: The arm is composed of 48 human volunteers to test 10% povidone-iodine (Isodine Solucion ®, Boehringer-Ingelheim Promeco, Mexico City), Hypochlorite 10% of electrochemical production (Exsept 10% ®, Pisa, Guadalajara, Mexico), and control.

intervention.description: Two antiseptics (10% povidone iodine and 10% sodium hypochlorite) and one control were tested as skin antiseptics. The intervention consisted of preparing the skin with the antiseptic or the control. The areas were approximately 25 cm2 on the forearm for each antiseptic or control. The antiseptic or control were applied in an outward circular motion using a swab that was soaked with the solution. The solution was then kept on the skin for 60 seconds before the bacterial culture was conducted. All volunteers were instructed to continue the use of neutral soap and shampoo without antiseptics during the follow-up period.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Healthy adult volunteers.
Exclusion Criteria:
- History of skin allergies or atopy, as well as reactions to soaps, iodine, chlorine, or latex

facility.name: University of Guanajuato School of Medicine

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Healthy volunteers recruited from August to December 2008 in the Microbiology Laboratory of University of Guanajuato, Mexico.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: For stabilization of skin microbiota, all volunteers used neutral soap and shampoo without antiseptics over a period of two weeks, being advised to avoid swimming in pools.

group.title: Whole Group
group.description: Human volunteers to test control, povidone-iodine and hypochlorite as skin antiseptics

group.description: Human volunteers to test control, povidone-iodine and hypochlorite as skin antiseptics

outcome.description: Bacterial colony count of skin cultures to determine antiseptic properties

group.title: Whole Group
group.description: Human volunteers to test control, povidone-iodine and hypochlorite as skin antiseptics

measure.title: Bacterial Count of Skin Cultures for the 10% Povidone-iodine Period
measure.description: Bacterial colony count of skin cultures to determine antiseptic properties

analysis.groups_desc: The null hypothesis established that the three medians were equal. To test significant differences for non-normally distributed data, a range test (Kruskal-Wallis) was used.
analysis.non_inferiority_desc: A minimal sample of 20 volunteers was calculated to to find a difference of 200 CFU/mL, with a power of 80% and bilateral error of 5%.
analysis.p_value_desc: Post-hoc test of Kruskal-Wallis for multiple comparisons of Z values was used to determine which arm was different.
analysis.method_desc: 2 degrees of freedom corrected for ties

outcome.title: Presence of Skin Reactions for the 10% Povidone-iodine Period
outcome.description: Presence of allergy or any skin reaction at 24 hours after the antiseptic application
outcome.population: A minimal sample of 20 volunteers was calculated to find a difference of 200 CFU/mL, with a power of 80%, and bilateral error of 5%. Analysis per protocol.

analysis.groups_desc: The null hypothesis established that the 3 medians were equal. To test significant differences for non-normally distributed data, a range test (Kruskal-Wallis) was used. The alpha level for significance was established at 5%. A minimal sample of 20 volunteers was calculated for a power of 80%, and bilateral error of 5%.
analysis.non_inferiority_desc: The minimal sample of 20 volunteers was calculated to find a difference of 200 CFU/mL.
analysis.p_value_desc: Post-hoc test of Kruskal-Wallis for multiple comparisons of Z values was used to determine which arm was different.
analysis.method_desc: 2 degrees of freedom corrected for ties

certain_agreements.pi_employee: All Principal Investigators ARE employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
